@lover: Yesterday, I was bombarded (chat and e-mails) with questions like "What happened at the end?" or "Is something after the last black-screen?" No, episode ended - I said in my responses.

Look, it really makes me sick - not the errors in encodings, but the stupid dispute "Who is smarter" and "Who has bigger".

Yesterday, for example - 3 x 720p releases, 3 x 1.09 Giga (and mouth-loud VIP guy presumably nave upped all of them and that way accomplished burning of few terabytes and more than few bucks of downloaders) - and all three with errors. It shouldn't be like that.

As you know - I do cut-outs of credits in all of my encodings. If someone wants to see who has been mic-holder, for sure he should pay a visit to cinema and not to expect that from pirated encoding. It is - stupid.

However - none of the episodes or movies should end in normal fade-out sequence. NEVER black frames if some kind of "the end" sign haven't appeared before. It really looks like plain fade-out which is normal and usual in any production/editing as transitional effect - between for example, two scenes or two continued sequences.
Anything else is just adding to confusion and - irresponsibility, lately typical for both the Scene and the consumers/uploaders/downloaders.
